parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name or any other identifying information.  The content discusses the Romanian political landscape generally, touching upon the ambiguity of ideologies and how parties manipulate this. It does not endorse or criticize any particular candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is clearly intended for a wide audience, not a specific individual or small group. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a broad targeting strategy.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post touches upon political themes relevant to the electoral context (ideologies, party strategies), its primary objective is not to influence voters to choose a specific candidate. The article linked in the post aims to provide analysis and context on the Romanian political landscape, not to advocate for a particular party or candidate. The analysis focuses on the ambiguity of the left-right political spectrum in Romania and how parties exploit this ambiguity.  It does not explicitly encourage or discourage voting for any particular party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post appears to be journalistic in nature. It presents an analysis of the Romanian political landscape, focusing on the ambiguity of ideologies and how parties use this to their advantage. The link directs to an article on the same topic, further suggesting a journalistic approach. The content is informative and analytical, not overtly persuasive or promotional.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion in a way that could be interpreted as influencing the vote. The analysis presented is objective and seeks to explain the complexities of the Romanian political system.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>580250941054768</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while dealing with political themes, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The analysis presented in the post and the linked article is journalistic in nature, aiming to inform and analyze the Romanian political landscape rather than to promote or discourage voting for specific candidates. The post does not directly advocate for or against any particular party or candidate, nor does it provide advice on voting at polling stations. The absence of any direct reference to specific candidates, combined with the informative and analytical nature of the content, suggests that the post does not violate the legal requirements.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>NEWBIZ ONLINE PUBLISHING S.R.L.</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
